meanings.definition: To grow beyond the normal or desired size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The plants in the garden overgrow and block the sunlight from reaching the other flowers.
meanings.sent2: If you don't trim the bushes regularly, they will overgrow and become unruly.
meanings.sent3: The grass decided to overgrow just to play a prank on the gardener.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him seemed to overgrow like a wild vine, wrapping around her heart.
meanings.sent5: The ivy seemed to overgrow the entire wall, creating a lush green tapestry.

meanings.definition: To grow too large or too quickly.
meanings.sent1: The population of rabbits in the forest can overgrow if not kept in check.
meanings.sent2: If you feed the fish too much, they may overgrow and outgrow their tank.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to overgrow the pan, creating a delicious mess in the oven.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement over the surprise party seemed to overgrow with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The weeds in the garden can overgrow quickly if not pulled out regularly.
